meanings.definition: Resembling chalk in color or texture.
meanings.sent1: The walls of the old house were the chalkiest I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: The artist used the chalkiest shade of white to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The chalkiest clouds in the sky looked like fluffy cotton candy.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was so pale, it was the chalkiest of all her friends.
meanings.sent5: The chalkiest snow on the mountain sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Having the highest proportion of chalk.
meanings.sent1: The chalkiest soil in the garden was perfect for growing certain plants.
meanings.sent2: The chalkiest cliffs along the coast were a stunning sight.
meanings.sent3: The chalkiest drink at the party was a strange mix of flavors.
meanings.sent4: His jokes were the chalkiest of all, always making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent5: The chalkiest rock in the quarry was difficult to carve but had a unique beauty.

meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of chalk.
meanings.sent1: The chalkiest classroom in the school had dust everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The chalkiest hands of the students showed they had been working hard.
meanings.sent3: The chalkiest cake at the bake sale was a big hit with the kids.
meanings.sent4: The chalkiest road in town was a challenge to drive on during the rain.
meanings.sent5: The chalkiest statue in the museum was a masterpiece of white stone.
